
# What's the Output?

::: notes
Focus: return values, intermediate level, 24 lines
::: 

## Exercise Goals

- Review of code syntax
- Check understanding of syntax

## What to Do

- Using the given code ...
- Compute the output (**MANUALLY**)

## What's the Output?

```{.cpp} 
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;
int multiply(int, int);
int subtract(int, int);
int compute(int);
int main() {
    int a = 4, b = 5;
    int result1 = multiply(a, b) + subtract(b, a);
    cout << result1 << endl;
    int result2 = compute(multiply(3, 2));
    cout << result2 << endl;
    cout << multiply(result1, 2) - compute(5) << endl;
    return 0;
}
int multiply(int x, int y) {
    return x * y;
}
int subtract(int x, int y) {
    return x - y;
}
int compute(int n) {
    return n + 10;
}
```

```{.cpp} 
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;
int multiply(int, int);
int subtract(int, int);
int compute(int);
int main() {
    int a = 4, b = 5;
    int result1 = multiply(a, b) + subtract(b, a);
    cout << result1 << endl;
    int result2 = compute(multiply(3, 2));
    cout << result2 << endl;
    cout << multiply(result1, 2) - compute(5) << endl;
    return 0;
}
int multiply(int x, int y) {
    return x * y;
}
int subtract(int x, int y) {
    return x - y;
}
int compute(int n) {
    return n + 10;
}
```
